titles.title: Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Examination Enhancement and Insurance Fund Protection Act

To strengthen the special examination authority of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation in order to protect the Bank Insurance Fund and the Savings Association Insurance Fund, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Financial Institutions and Consumer Credit.

committee.name: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services

bill.summary: 11/16/1999--Introduced. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation Examination Enhancement and Insurance Fund Protection Act - Amends the Federal Deposit Insurance Act regarding special examinations of an insured depository institution to require that all reasonable efforts be made to: (1) coordinate FDIC special examinations with other Federal or State regulatory entities; and (2) minimize the disruptive effects of such examinations upon institution operations.Mandates that the Federal banking agencies: (1) grant access to the FDIC in as prompt a manner as practicable with respect to reports of examination and reports of conditions; and (2) establish procedures for providing the FDIC with access to additional information as needed for insurance purposes.
